sentences.sentence: The Flowers were quite angry that the Dwarf( 小矮人 ) had so rudely( 粗鲁地 ) rushed into their beautiful garden.
When they saw him dancing up and down the paths( 小路 ), and waving( 挥舞 ) his arms above his head in such a silly manner, they could not hold back their feelings any longer.
“He is really far too ugly to be allowed to play in any place where we are,” cried the Tulips( 郁金香 ).
“He is really horrible( 十分讨厌的 )!” screamed( 尖叫 ) the Lilies( 百合花 ).
“His arms and legs are short and twisted( 扭曲变形的 ), and his head is too large for his body.
It makes me feel sick to look at him.”
“And he has stolen one of my best flowers,” cried the White Rose Tree.
“I gave it to the Infanta( 公主 ) this morning myself, as a birthday present, and he has taken it from her.”
And then she called out: “Thief( 小偷 ), thief( 小偷 ), thief( 小偷 )!” at the top of her voice.
But the Birds liked him.
They had seen him often in the forest, dancing around in the fallen leaves, or sitting under an old oak tree( 橡树 ), sharing his bread with the squirrels( 松鼠 ).
They did not mind that he was ugly, at all.
After all, even the Nightingale( 夜莺 ) herself, who sang so sweetly at night that sometimes the moon came down to listen, was not very good-looking.
Besides, the Dwarf( 小矮人 ) had been kind to them, and during that very cold winter,
when there was nothing to eat on the trees, he had never once forgotten about them.
Every day he had come out to give them pieces of bread, and shared with them whatever poor breakfast he had.
So they flew around him, lightly brushing his face with their wings as they passed.
This pleased the little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) so greatly that he could not stop himself from showing them the beautiful white rose,
and telling them that the Infanta( 公主 ) herself had given it to him because she loved him.
They did not understand a single word of what he was saying, but that did not matter.
They put their heads on one side, and looked wise, which is just as good as understanding a thing, and much easier.
The Lizards( 蜥蜴 ) also liked him very much.
When he grew tired of running around and lay down on the grass to rest, they played and ran all over him, and tried to make him laugh.
“Not every one can be as beautiful as a lizard( 蜥蜴 ),” they cried. “That would be too much to expect.
And, although it sounds ridiculous( 荒谬的 ) to say so, he is really not so ugly after all.
But only, of course, if you shut your eyes, and do not look at him.”
The Flowers, however, were greatly angered by the Lizards’( 蜥蜴 ) and the Birds’ behavior( 行为 ).
“It only shows,” they said, “how foolish( 愚蠢的 ) and rude( 粗鲁的 ) people become when always flying and rushing around.
Civilized( 有礼貌的 ) people always stay exactly in the same place, like we do.
No one ever saw us dancing up and down the paths( 小路 ).
When we want to go somewhere, we call for the gardener, and he carries us to another bed.
This is respectable, and as it should be.
But Birds and Lizards( 蜥蜴 ) are constantly( 经常 ) moving around like the gypsies( 吉普赛人 ), and should be treated in exactly the same manner.”
So they put their noses in the air, and turned away from the Dwarf( 小矮人 ).
They were quite pleased when the Dwarf( 小矮人 ) at last stood up from the grass, and began to make his way toward to the palace.
“He should certainly be kept indoors for the rest of his life,” they said.
“Look at his crooked( 弯曲的 ) back, and his twisted( 扭曲变形的 ) legs,” and they began to laugh.
But the little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) knew nothing of all this.
He liked the Birds and the Lizards( 蜥蜴 ) very much, and thought that the Flowers were the most wonderful things in the whole world, except of course for the Infanta( 公主 ).
But then she had given him the beautiful white rose, and she loved him, and that made a great difference.
How he wished that he had gone back with her!

article_info.previous: 吉普赛人的表演博得满堂喝彩。随后矮人的意外出现，带来一段滑稽的舞蹈，令公主和朋友们捧腹大笑。公主甚至将头上的玫瑰花送给了矮人。
article_info.share_words: They had seen him often in the forest, dancing around in the fallen leaves, or sitting under an old oak tree, sharing his bread with the squirrels. They did not mind that he was ugly, at all. After all, even the Nightingale herself, who sang so sweetly at night that sometimes the moon came down to listen, was not very good-looking.

options.cn: 因为矮人很粗鲁地闯进了它们的花园。
options.en: Because the Dwarf rudely rushed into their garden.

options.cn: 因为他们认为矮人太丑了。
options.en: Because they thought the Dwarf were ugly.

analysis: 文中提到“The Flowers were quite angry that the Dwarf had so rudely rushed into their beautiful garden. ”下文也提到“He is really far too ugly to be allowed to play in any place where we are.”因此本题选C。

question.cn: 鸟儿们对矮人的态度如何？
question.en: What was the birds' attitude towards the Dwarf?

options.en: They didn't pay any attention to him.

analysis: 文中提交“But the Birds liked him. They had seen him often in the forest, dancing around in the fallen leaves, or sitting under an old oak tree, sharing his bread with the squirrels. ”因此本题选B。

question.cn: 在矮人看来，公主为何给他玫瑰花？
question.en: Why, in the Dwarf’s opinion, did the Infanta give him the rose?

options.en: He thought that the Infanta was fond of roses.
He thought that the Infanta loved him.

options.cn: 他认为公主想跟他做朋友。
options.en: He thought that the Infanta wanted to make friends with him.

analysis: 文中提到“This pleased the little Dwarf so greatly that he could not stop himself from showing them the beautiful white rose, and telling them that the Infanta herself had given it to him because she loved him.”他认为公主喜欢他，因此本题选B。

question.cn: 谁觉得矮人应该一辈子待在家里不出门？
question.en: Who thought that the Dwarf should certainly be kept indoors for the rest of his life?

analysis: 文中提到：“He should certainly be kept indoors for the rest of his life.” they said. 这里的they联系上下文指的是花儿们。因此答案选A。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第42天
